alert.note: Alert for Dubois (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 29 at 9:44AM EDT until June 29 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Indiana, including the following county, Dubois. * WHEN...Until 1245 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 943 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Water has been reported on roadways just west of Huntingburg. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jasper, Huntingburg, Ferdinand, Holland, Duff, Millersport, Huntingburg Airport, Ireland, Maltersville and Johnsburg. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
